address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

did.abstract: Andrew Cecil Bradley, English literary scholar. In 1901 he was elected as Oxford Professor of Poetry. To Charles Dealtry Locock, writer and editor : 9 autograph letters signed : ca. 1904 - 1906 (S'ANA 0956--0964), relating to Shelley and Locock's work on Shelley. Two envelopes from Bradley to Locock (one in the hand of another) were assigned the call number (S'ANA 0983).

bioghist.p: Andrew Cecil Bradley, English literary scholar. In 1901 he was elected as Oxford Professor of Poetry.

scopecontent.p: To Charles Dealtry Locock, writer and editor : 9 autograph letters signed : ca. 1904 - 1906 (S'ANA 0956--0964), relating to Shelley and Locock's work on Shelley. Two envelopes from Bradley to Locock (one in the hand of another) were assigned the call number (S'ANA 0983).

prefercite.p: A. C. Bradley manuscript material : 9 items, Carl H. Pforzheimer Collection of Shelley and His Circle, The New York Public Library
